The General engine (available in all lan.value: The General engine (available in all languages) is trained in all types of texts and will translate the text you input using the most commonly used terms for the language. It is a quick way to gain an understanding of the text you have entered.

This indicates whether or not a match ha.value: This indicates whether or not a match has been found in the translation memory. “New” means that no match was found, whilst “101%” means that the content and context of a segment exactly matches the sentence stored. Any number under 101% means it is a “fuzzy match” (1-99%), where the content and context differ. Fuzzy matches vary depending on how closely the segment matches the one stored in the translation memory. Once a segment has been translated and confirmed, it is automatically added to the database and will be automatically reused if the same or similar segment is detected.

You can leave a comment to the translato.value: You can leave a comment to the translator.

To approve the existing text, or to conf.value: To approve the existing text, or to confirm your changes in the segment, click on the grey “check” icon next to the segment. After that, the icon colour will change to green. You can also use Ctrl+Enter to submit and approve segment, or Enter to submit it without approval.
